location.Description: The Azure Region of the resource.

properties.Description: Properties of the Media Services account.

storageAccounts.Description: The storage accounts for this resource.

id.Description: The ID of the storage account resource. Media Services relies on tables and queues as well as blobs, so the primary storage account must be a Standard Storage account (either Microsoft.ClassicStorage or Microsoft.Storage). Blob only storage accounts can be added as secondary storage accounts.

type.Description: The type of the storage account. Possible values include: 'Primary', 'Secondary'

created.Description: The creation date of the Asset.

lastModified.Description: The last modified date of the Asset.

alternateId.Description: The alternate ID of the Asset.

container.Description: The name of the asset blob container.

storageAccountName.Description: The name of the storage account.

storageEncryptionFormat.Description: The Asset encryption format. One of None or MediaStorageEncryption. Possible values include: 'None', 'MediaStorageClientEncryption'

properties.Description: The properties of the Content Key Policy.

created.Description: The creation date of the Policy

lastModified.Description: The last modified date of the Policy

configuration.Description: Base class for Content Key Policy configuration. A derived class must be used to create a configuration.

restriction.Description: Base class for Content Key Policy restrictions. A derived class must be used to create a restriction.

@odata.type.Description: Represents a configuration for non-DRM keys.
Represents a ContentKeyPolicyConfiguration that is unavailable in the current API version.
Specifies a configuration for Widevine licenses.
Specifies a configuration for PlayReady licenses.

allowTestDevices.Description: A flag indicating whether test devices can use the license.

relativeBeginDate.Description: The relative begin date of license.

relativeExpirationDate.Description: The relative expiration date of license.

playRight.Description: Configures the Play Right in the PlayReady license.

licenseType.Description: The license type. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'NonPersistent', 'Persistent'

contentKeyLocation.Description: Base class for content key ID location. A derived class must be used to represent the location.

contentType.Description: The PlayReady content type. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'Unspecified', 'UltraVioletDownload', 'UltraVioletStreaming'

firstPlayExpiration.Description: The amount of time that the license is valid after the license is first used to play content.

scmsRestriction.Description: Configures the Serial Copy Management System (SCMS) in the license. Must be between 0 and 3 inclusive.

agcAndColorStripeRestriction.Description: Configures Automatic Gain Control (AGC) and Color Stripe in the license. Must be between 0 and 3 inclusive.

explicitAnalogTelevisionOutputRestrictio.Description: Configures the Explicit Analog Television Output Restriction control bits. For further details see the PlayReady Compliance Rules.

digitalVideoOnlyContentRestriction.Description: Enables the Image Constraint For Analog Component Video Restriction in the license.

imageConstraintForAnalogComponentVideoRe.Description: Enables the Image Constraint For Analog Component Video Restriction in the license.

imageConstraintForAnalogComputerMonitorR.Description: Enables the Image Constraint For Analog Component Video Restriction in the license.

allowPassingVideoContentToUnknownOutput.Description: Configures Unknown output handling settings of the license. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'NotAllowed', 'Allowed', 'AllowedWithVideoConstriction'

uncompressedDigitalVideoOpl.Description: Specifies the output protection level for uncompressed digital video.

compressedDigitalVideoOpl.Description: Specifies the output protection level for compressed digital video.

analogVideoOpl.Description: Specifies the output protection level for compressed digital audio.

compressedDigitalAudioOpl.Description: Specifies the output protection level for compressed digital audio.

uncompressedDigitalAudioOpl.Description: Specifies the output protection level for uncompressed digital audio.

bestEffort.Description: Indicates whether this restriction is enforced on a Best Effort basis.

configurationData.Description: Configures the restriction control bits. Must be between 0 and 3 inclusive.

@odata.type.Description: Specifies that the content key ID is in the PlayReady header.
Specifies that the content key ID is specified in the PlayReady configuration.

ask.Description: The key that must be used as FairPlay ASk.

fairPlayPfxPassword.Description: The password encrypting FairPlay certificate in PKCS 12 (pfx) format.

fairPlayPfx.Description: The Base64 representation of FairPlay certificate in PKCS 12 (pfx) format (including private key).

rentalAndLeaseKeyType.Description: The rental and lease key type. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'Undefined', 'PersistentUnlimited', 'PersistentLimited'

rentalDuration.Description: The rental duration. Must be greater than or equal to 0.

@odata.type.Description: Specifies a configuration for FairPlay licenses.
Represents an open restriction. License or key will be delivered on every request.
Represents a ContentKeyPolicyRestriction that is unavailable in the current API version.

primaryVerificationKey.Description: Base class for Content Key Policy key for token validation. A derived class must be used to create a token key.

alternateVerificationKeys.Description: A list of alternative verification keys.

requiredClaims.Description: A list of required token claims.

restrictionTokenType.Description: The type of token. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'Swt', 'Jwt'

@odata.type.Description: Represents a token restriction. Provided token must match these requirements for successful license or key delivery.

keyValue.Description: The key value of the key

@odata.type.Description: Specifies a symmetric key for token validation.
Specifies a RSA key for token validation

rawBody.Description: The raw data field of a certificate in PKCS 12 format (X509Certificate2 in .NET)

@odata.type.Description: Specifies a certificate for token validation.

created.Description: The UTC date and time when the Transform was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' format.

description.Description: An optional verbose description of the Transform.

lastModified.Description: The UTC date and time when the Transform was last updated, in 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' format.

outputs.Description: An array of one or more TransformOutputs that the Transform should generate.

onError.Description: A Transform can define more than one outputs. This property defines what the service should do when one output fails - either continue to produce other outputs, or, stop the other outputs. The default is stop. Possible values include: 'StopProcessingJob', 'ContinueJob'

relativePriority.Description: Sets the relative priority of the TransformOutputs within a Transform. This sets the priority that the service uses for processing TransformOutputs. The default priority is Normal. Possible values include: 'Low', 'Normal', 'High'

preset.Description: Base type for all Presets, which define the recipe or instructions on how the input media files should be processed.

audioLanguage.Description: The language for the audio payload in the input using the BCP-47 format of 'language tag-region' (e.g: 'en-US'). The list of supported languages are, 'en-US', 'en-GB', 'es-ES', 'es-MX', 'fr-FR', 'it-IT', 'ja-JP', 'pt-BR', 'zh-CN'.

@odata.type.Description: The Audio Analyzer preset applies a pre-defined set of AI-based analysis operations, including speech transcription. Currently, the preset supports processing of content with a single audio track.

presetName.Description: The built-in preset to be used for encoding videos. Possible values include: 'AdaptiveStreaming', 'AACGoodQualityAudio', 'H264MultipleBitrate1080p', 'H264MultipleBitrate720p', 'H264MultipleBitrateSD'

@odata.type.Description: Describes a built-in preset for encoding the input video with the Standard Encoder.

filters.Description: Describes all the filtering operations, such as de-interlacing, rotation etc. that are to be applied to the input media before encoding.

codecs.Description: The list of codecs to be used when encoding the input video.

formats.Description: The list of outputs to be produced by the encoder.

@odata.type.Description: Describes all the settings to be used when encoding the input video with the Standard Encoder.

rotation.Description: The rotation, if any, to be applied to the input video, before it is encoded. Default is Auto. Possible values include: 'Auto', 'None', 'Rotate0', 'Rotate90', 'Rotate180', 'Rotate270'

crop.Description: Describes the properties of a rectangular window applied to the input media before processing it.

overlays.Description: The properties of overlays to be applied to the input video. These could be audio, image or video overlays.

parity.Description: The field parity for de-interlacing, defaults to Auto. Possible values include: 'Auto', 'TopFieldFirst', 'BottomFieldFirst'

mode.Description: The deinterlacing mode. Defaults to AutoPixelAdaptive. Possible values include: 'Off', 'AutoPixelAdaptive'

left.Description: The number of pixels from the left-margin. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (For example, 50%).

top.Description: The number of pixels from the top-margin. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (For example, 50%).

width.Description: The width of the rectangular region in pixels. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (For example, 50%).

height.Description: The height of the rectangular region in pixels. This can be absolute pixel value (e.g 100), or relative to the size of the video (For example, 50%).

inputLabel.Description: The label of the job input which is to be used as an overlay. The Input must specify exactly one file. You can specify an image file in JPG or PNG formats, or an audio file (such as a WAV, MP3, WMA or M4A file), or a video file. See https://aka.ms/mesformats for the complete list of supported audio and video file formats.

start.Description: The start position, with reference to the input video, at which the overlay starts. The value should be in ISO 8601 format. For example, PT05S to start the overlay at 5 seconds in to the input video. If not specified the overlay starts from the beginning of the input video.

end.Description: The position in the input video at which the overlay ends. The value should be in ISO 8601 duration format. For example, PT30S to end the overlay at 30 seconds in to the input video. If not specified the overlay will be applied until the end of the input video if inputLoop is true. Else, if inputLoop is false, then overlay will last as long as the duration of the overlay media.

fadeInDuration.Description: The duration over which the overlay fades in onto the input video. The value should be in ISO 8601 duration format. If not specified the default behavior is to have no fade in (same as PT0S).

fadeOutDuration.Description: The duration over which the overlay fades out of the input video. The value should be in ISO 8601 duration format. If not specified the default behavior is to have no fade out (same as PT0S).

audioGainLevel.Description: The gain level of audio in the overlay. The value should be in the range [0, 1.0]. The default is 1.0.

@odata.type.Description: Describes the properties of an audio overlay.

position.Description: Describes the properties of a rectangular window applied to the input media before processing it.

opacity.Description: The opacity of the overlay. This is a value in the range [0 - 1.0]. Default is 1.0 which mean the overlay is opaque.

cropRectangle.Description: Describes the properties of a rectangular window applied to the input media before processing it.

@odata.type.Description: Describes the properties of a video overlay.

label.Description: An optional label for the codec. The label can be used to control muxing behavior.

channels.Description: The number of channels in the audio.

samplingRate.Description: The sampling rate to use for encoding in hertz.

bitrate.Description: The bitrate, in bits per second, of the output encoded audio.

@odata.type.Description: Defines the common properties for all audio codecs.
A codec flag, which tells the encoder to copy the input video bitstream without re-encoding.

keyFrameInterval.Description: The distance between two key frames, thereby defining a group of pictures (GOP). The value should be a non-zero integer in the range [1, 30] seconds, specified in ISO 8601 format. The default is 2 seconds (PT2S).

stretchMode.Description: The resizing mode - how the input video will be resized to fit the desired output resolution(s). Default is AutoSize. Possible values include: 'None', 'AutoSize', 'AutoFit'

@odata.type.Description: Describes the basic properties for encoding the input video.
A codec flag, which tells the encoder to copy the input audio bitstream.

filenamePattern.Description: The pattern of the file names for the generated output files. The following macros are supported in the file name: {Basename} - The base name of the input video {Extension} - The appropriate extension for this format. {Label} - The label assigned to the codec/layer. {Index} - A unique index for thumbnails. Only applicable to thumbnails. {Bitrate} - The audio/video bitrate. Not applicable to thumbnails. {Codec} - The type of the audio/video codec. Any unsubstituted macros will be collapsed and removed from the filename.

@odata.type.Description: Describes the properties for an output image file.

outputFiles.Description: The list of output files to produce.  Each entry in the list is a set of audio and video layer labels to be muxed together .

@odata.type.Description: Describes the properties for producing a collection of GOP aligned multi-bitrate files. The default behavior is to produce one output file for each video layer which is muxed together with all the audios. The exact output files produced can be controlled by specifying the outputFiles collection.

labels.Description: The list of labels that describe how the encoder should multiplex video and audio into an output file. For example, if the encoder is producing two video layers with labels v1 and v2, and one audio layer with label a1, then an array like '[v1, a1]' tells the encoder to produce an output file with the video track represented by v1 and the audio track represented by a1.

created.Description: The UTC date and time when the Job was created, in 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' format.

state.Description: The current state of the job. Possible values include: 'Canceled', 'Canceling', 'Error', 'Finished', 'Processing', 'Queued', 'Scheduled'

description.Description: Optional customer supplied description of the Job.

input.Description: Base class for inputs to a Job.

lastModified.Description: The UTC date and time when the Job was last updated, in 'YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssZ' format.

priority.Description: Priority with which the job should be processed. Higher priority jobs are processed before lower priority jobs. If not set, the default is normal. Possible values include: 'Low', 'Normal', 'High'

correlationData.Description: Customer provided correlation data that will be returned in Job completed events.

label.Description: A label that is assigned to a JobInput, that is used to satisfy a reference used in the Transform. For example, a Transform can be authored so as to take an image file with the label 'xyz' and apply it as an overlay onto the input video before it is encoded. When submitting a Job, exactly one of the JobInputs should be the image file, and it should have the label 'xyz'.

files.Description: List of files. Required for JobInputHttp.

@odata.type.Description: Represents input files for a Job.

inputs.Description: List of inputs to a Job.

@odata.type.Description: Describes a list of inputs to a Job.

state.Description: Describes the state of the JobOutput. Possible values include: 'Canceled', 'Canceling', 'Error', 'Finished', 'Processing', 'Queued', 'Scheduled'

progress.Description: If the JobOutput is in a Processing state, this contains the job completion percentage.  The value is an estimate and not intended to be used to predict job completion times. To determine if the JobOutput is complete, use the State property.

code.Description: Error code describing the error. Possible values include: 'ServiceError', 'ServiceTransientError', 'DownloadNotAccessible', 'DownloadTransientError', 'UploadNotAccessible', 'UploadTransientError', 'ConfigurationUnsupported', 'ContentMalformed', 'ContentUnsupported'

message.Description: A human-readable language-dependent representation of the error.

category.Description: Helps with categorization of errors. Possible values include: 'Service', 'Download', 'Upload', 'Configuration', 'Content'

retry.Description: Indicates that it may be possible to retry the Job. If retry is unsuccessful, please contact Azure support via Azure Portal. Possible values include: 'DoNotRetry', 'MayRetry'

details.Description: An array of details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

message.Description: A human-readable representation of the error.

assetName.Description: The name of the output Asset.

@odata.type.Description: Represents an Asset used as a JobOutput.

properties.Description: Class to specify properties of Streaming Policy

defaultContentKeyPolicyName.Description: Default ContentKey used by current Streaming Policy

enabledProtocols.Description: Class to specify which protocols are enabled

clearTracks.Description: Representing which tracks should not be encrypted

contentKeys.Description: Class to specify properties of all content keys in Streaming Policy

customKeyAcquisitionUrlTemplate.Description: KeyAcquisitionUrlTemplate is used to point to user specified service to delivery content keys

trackSelections.Description: TrackSelections is a track property condition list which can specify track(s)

property.Description: Track property type. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'FourCC'

operation.Description: Track property condition operation. Possible values include: 'Unknown', 'Equal'

defaultKey.Description: Class to specify properties of default content key for each encryption scheme

keyToTrackMappings.Description: Representing tracks needs separate content key

label.Description: Label can be used to specify Content Key when creating a Streaming Locator
Label can be used to specify Content Key when creating a Streaming Locator

tracks.Description: Tracks which use this content key

enabledProtocols.Description: Class to specify which protocols are enabled

clearTracks.Description: Representing which tracks should not be encrypted

contentKeys.Description: Class to specify properties of all content keys in Streaming Policy

drm.Description: Class to specify DRM configurations of CommonEncryptionCenc scheme in Streaming Policy

playReady.Description: Class to specify configurations of PlayReady in Streaming Policy

widevine.Description: Class to specify configurations of Widevine in Streaming Policy

customLicenseAcquisitionUrlTemplate.Description: The template for a customer service to deliver keys to end users.  Not needed when using Azure Media Services for issuing keys.
The template for a customer service to deliver keys to end users.  Not needed when using Azure Media Services for issuing keys.

enabledProtocols.Description: Class to specify which protocols are enabled

clearTracks.Description: Representing which tracks should not be encrypted

contentKeys.Description: Class to specify properties of all content keys in Streaming Policy

drm.Description: Class to specify DRM configurations of CommonEncryptionCbcs scheme in Streaming Policy

fairPlay.Description: Class to specify configurations of FairPlay in Streaming Policy

playReady.Description: Class to specify configurations of PlayReady in Streaming Policy

widevine.Description: Class to specify configurations of Widevine in Streaming Policy

customLicenseAcquisitionUrlTemplate.Description: The template for a customer service to deliver keys to end users.  Not needed when using Azure Media Services for issuing keys.

allowPersistentLicense.Description: All license to be persistent or not

enabledProtocols.Description: Class to specify which protocols are enabled

properties.Description: Class to specify properties of Streaming Locator

streamingPolicyName.Description: Streaming policy name used by this streaming locator. Either specify the name of streaming policy you created or use one of the predefined streaming polices. The predefined streaming policies available are: 'Predefined_DownloadOnly', 'Predefined_ClearStreamingOnly', 'Predefined_DownloadAndClearStreaming', 'Predefined_ClearKey', 'Predefined_SecureStreaming' and 'Predefined_SecureStreamingWithFairPlay'

defaultContentKeyPolicyName.Description: Default ContentKeyPolicy used by this Streaming Locator

contentKeys.Description: ContentKeys used by this Streaming Locator

alternativeMediaId.Description: An Alternative Media Identifier associated with the StreamingLocator.  This identifier can be used to distinguish different StreamingLocators for the same Asset for authorization purposes in the CustomLicenseAcquisitionUrlTemplate or the CustomKeyAcquisitionUrlTemplate of the StreamingPolicy specified in the StreamingPolicyName field.

type.Description: Encryption type of Content Key. Possible values include: 'CommonEncryptionCenc', 'CommonEncryptionCbcs', 'EnvelopeEncryption'

tracks.Description: Tracks which use this Content Key

location.Description: The Azure Region of the resource.

provisioningState.Description: The provisioning state of the Live Event.

resourceState.Description: The resource state of the Live Event. Possible values include: 'Stopped', 'Starting', 'Running', 'Stopping', 'Deleting'

vanityUrl.Description: The Live Event vanity URL flag.

created.Description: The exact time the Live Event was created.

lastModified.Description: The exact time the Live Event was last modified.

streamingProtocol.Description: The streaming protocol for the Live Event. Possible values include: 'FragmentedMP4', 'RTMP'

keyFrameIntervalDuration.Description: ISO 8601 timespan duration of the key frame interval duration.

endpoints.Description: The input endpoints for the Live Event.

accessControl.Description: The IP access control for Live Event preview.

streamingPolicyName.Description: The name of streaming policy used for LiveEvent preview

alternativeMediaId.Description: An Alternative Media Identifier associated with the preview url.  This identifier can be used to distinguish the preview of different live events for authorization purposes in the CustomLicenseAcquisitionUrlTemplate or the CustomKeyAcquisitionUrlTemplate of the StreamingPolicy specified in the StreamingPolicyName field.

name.Description: The friendly name for the IP address range.

subnetPrefixLength.Description: The subnet mask prefix length (see CIDR notation).

encodingType.Description: The encoding type for Live Event. Possible values include: 'None', 'Basic'

clientAccessPolicy.Description: The content of clientaccesspolicy.xml used by Silverlight.

crossDomainPolicy.Description: The content of crossdomain.xml used by Silverlight.

properties.Description: The JSON object that contains the properties required to create a Live Output.

description.Description: The description of the Live Output.

archiveWindowLength.Description: ISO 8601 timespan duration of the archive window length. This is duration that customer want to retain the recorded content.

created.Description: The exact time the Live Output was created.

lastModified.Description: The exact time the Live Output was last modified.

provisioningState.Description: The provisioning state of the Live Output.

resourceState.Description: The resource state of the Live Output. Possible values include: 'Creating', 'Running', 'Deleting'

fragmentsPerTsSegment.Description: The amount of fragments per HTTP Live Streaming (HLS) segment.

location.Description: The Azure Region of the resource.

customHostNames.Description: The custom host names of the StreamingEndpoint

provisioningState.Description: The provisioning state of the StreamingEndpoint.

resourceState.Description: The resource state of the StreamingEndpoint. Possible values include: 'Stopped', 'Starting', 'Running', 'Stopping', 'Deleting', 'Scaling'

created.Description: The exact time the StreamingEndpoint was created.

lastModified.Description: The exact time the StreamingEndpoint was last modified.

expiration.Description: The exact time the authentication key.
